brief_summary.textblock:
To determine safety profile of immunotherapy with natural killer cells and activated
      expanded (NKAEs) after salvage chemotherapy in relapsed/refractory paediatric T cell
      lymphoblastic leukaemia and lymphoma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Salvage Therapy With Chemotherapy and Natural Killer Cells in Relapsed/Refractory Paediatric T Cell Lymphoblastic Leukaemia and Lymphoma
clinical_study.condition: Relapsed/Refractory Paediatric T Cell Lymphoblastic Leukaemia and Lymphoma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients aged between 0 and 21 years with relapsed or refractary acute lymphoblastic
             leukemia or T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma.

          -  Lansky Index > 60%.

          -  Left ventricular ejection fraction > 39%.

          -  Negative HIV serology.

          -  Provide informed consent in accordance with current legislation.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with a history of poor compliance.

          -  Patients not valid after psycho-social evaluation

          -  Severe (4) functional organ disorders (hepatic, renal, respiratory) according to NCI
             CTCAE v3 criteria

facility.name: Pediatric Hematology-Oncology; Hospital Infantil Universitario La Paz

clinical_study.official_title: Salvage Therapy With Chemotherapy and Natural Killer Cells in Relapsed/Refractory Paediatric T Cell Lymphoblastic Leukaemia and Lymphoma.

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Agencia Española de Medicamentos y Productos Sanitarios

primary_outcome.measure: Safety profile (number of AEs per patient)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of episodes of febrile neutropenia, bacteriemia or viral or fungal infections

secondary_outcome.description: hematological recovery: neutrophils >500/mm3, lymphocytes >250/mm3 and platelets >50.000/mm3)

secondary_outcome.measure: days of hospitalization in each cycle

secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate according to cytomorphic and by "minimal residual disease" criteria (cytometry and/or real time PCR)

clinical_study.source: Hospital Infantil Universitario Niño Jesús, Madrid, Spain

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Infantil Universitario Niño Jesús, Madrid, Spain

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
